p:
Dong et al.,
13 described eleven selected cases of patients with COVID-19, children and adults, demonstrating the profile complexity and different clinical presentations, from asymptomatic cases to patients with mild to severe symptoms. Patients with common allergic diseases, such as rhinitis or atopic dermatitis, did not develop distinct symptoms and severe clinical courses, suggesting a role of type 2 immune regulation in COVID-19 pathogenesis.
